title: Tony Gilroy Fought Hard to Try and Get Andor the First Star Wars F-Bomb
description:
As Star Wars has grown and modernized, more and more bits of our own evolving lexicon have become part of its dialogue—and cursing is no exception. For every dank ferrik and sithspit, there’s been mild curses from the “real world.” Already Andor made a transgressive step in having key characters use real cursing, but…

Read more...

title: Zume, SoftBank’s $445 Million Robot Pizza Startup, Is Cooked
description:
Zume, a tech company most people have probably never heard of—but that was once worth nearly half a billion dollars—is officially dead. The company, which wanted to use robots, data collection, and high tech culinary innovation to disrupt the pizza delivery business, is officially insolvent and is currently in the…

Read more...

title: Elemental Proves Pixar Is at Its Best When Taking Big Swings
description:
Venture into a new imaginative world where the elements have to co-exist in a society not too different than ours in Pixar’s Elemental.

Read more...

title: Twitter's New CEO Makes It Clear: This Is Elon's Ship, She's Just Running It
description:
Shortly after taking the helm from Elon Musk, Twitter’s new CEO Linda Yaccarino is making it clear that she’ll be frictionless against Musk’s incoherent “vision” for the social media platform.

Read more...

title: Strange New Worlds' Melissa Navia Talks About Star Trek Fan Reactions | io9 Interview
description: Read more...

title: NYC Delays Strict Short-Term Registration Deadline for AirBnbs
description:
New York City has passed one of the strictest laws against short-term rentals in the country but has agreed to delay implementing it until September. The law, known as Local Law 18, would require Airbnb hosts to register for an operating license.

Read more...

title: Uber, DoorDash, and Other Delivery Apps Will Now Have to Pay Workers a Minimum Wage in NYC
description:
Uber, Grubhub, DoorDash, and their delivery app peers will soon have to pay couriers a minimum wage in New York City. The most populous U.S. metropolis officially enacted the landmark pay floor for food delivery on Sunday, as announced at City Hall by Mayor Eric Adams and Senator Chuck Schumer.

Read more...

title: The Origin of Star Wars' Upcoming Dawn of the Jedi Movie
description:
Who was the first person to wield the Force? It’s a concept so far away from the Star Wars stories we’ve been following, both in and out of canon for the past 40 years, it’s almost impossible to fathom. But soon, not only will someone fathom it, we’ll see how it happened on the big screen.

Read more...

title: AI at the Office Makes You a Lonely, Sleepless Alcoholic, New Study Finds
description:
Artificial Intelligence has upended the workplace, bringing with it mass layoffs and the fear that it will destroy humanity as we know it, but a new study reveals the damaging effects don’t end there. A group of researchers set out to uncover the emotional toll AI can have on an individual’s psyche in the workplace,…

Read more...

title: Hubble Scientists Develop Software Fix for Satellite Streaks in Images
description:
The Hubble Space Telescope images the cosmos from low Earth orbit, but an abundance of artificial satellites circle the planet at higher altitudes. That’s become an irritation in recent years, as the thousands of devices leave bright streaks in Hubble imagery.

Read more...

title: Wes Anderson's Asteroid City Is Over-Stylized and Under-Realized
description:
Wes Anderson’s work, especially recently, has become more akin to a spectacle than a complete story, and Asteroid City is a tongue-in-cheek exploration of just how much emphasis on style Anderson can get away with. With deadpan deliveries across the board, a palette that switches between vivid desert hues and stark…

Read more...

title: China Tests Parachute System to Control Falling Rocket Boosters
description:
In an effort to prevent falling rockets from landing on populated areas, China tested a parachute system designed to control where its rocket boosters land back on Earth.

Read more...

title: Just Like Humans, Dogs Thrive When They Have Friends, Study Finds
description:
Recent research shows that dogs and humans have a lot in common when it comes to staying healthy. The study—a large survey of dog owners and their pups—found several key environmental factors linked to better health and longevity in dogs, such as a strong social network. The results are the latest to suggest that dogs…

Read more...

title: Sam Altman Is 'Optimistic' He Can Get the AI Laws He Wants
description:
Sam Altman, the CEO of ChatGPT maker OpenAI, is wrapping up a jet-setting tour of meetings with world leaders in an effort to steer global AI regulation. Altman and his company want lawmakers thinking more about a potential future where AI destroys society, and less about not the problems AI will wreak in the short…

Read more...

title: Chatbots Have Stolen Fanfiction From a Gift Culture
description:
First, a confession. I’ve written fanfiction. Like, a lot of fanfic. In my spare time, I still write fic! (I’m currently writing a couple of fics for Interview With the Vampire and Trigun! It’s going great, thank you.) Over the course of the past 15 years I’ve published around 750,000 words of fic, and just to give…

Read more...

title: Webb Telescope Reveals How Light Emerged From the Fog of the Early Universe
description:
Over 20,000 galaxies glimmer in this sweeping view of the sky between the constellations of Pisces and Andromeda. But more than just an arresting sight, the view has helped astronomers determine what sparked the Epoch of Reionization, the period when the opaque universe gave way to the transparent one.

Read more...

title: This Ninja Turtle Giant Robot Is the Best, Weirdest Toy Collaboration of the Year
description:
Few things are not improved by the presence of giant robots. So when you take something known for totally radical excess like Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and transform its heroes into their own giant-sized mechanical selves, it’s hard to imagine it going wrong. And yet, taken to just the amount right of excess, it’s…

Read more...

title: Please Let Us Play Star Wars Outlaws Right Now
description:
Over the weekend, Ubisoft announced that in 2024 it would release the world’s first open-world Star Wars game: Star Wars Outlaws. Set between the events of The Empire Strikes Back and Return of the Jedi, it follows a scoundrel named Kay Vess, who has to pull off the heist of her life.

Read more...

title: Avatar Opens Pandora's Box in a New First-Person Open-World Game
description:
Avatar: The Way of Water came out late last year and established director James Cameron’s return to the world of Pandora and, naturally, the franchise opportunities that were in the pipeline. Today, Ubisoft released the first trailer for Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora, a new game on the yet-unseen Western side of…

Read more...

title: FTC Reportedly Plans to File an Injunction Microsoft's Acquisition of Activision Blizzard
description:
The mountain of pushback against the largest acquisition in gaming history just got a fair bit steeper. On Monday, CNBC reported that the Federal Trade Commission is close to filing an injunction to block the $68.7 billion merger between Microsoft and Activision Blizzard.

Read more...

title: You Can Finally Pre-Order These E-Reader Goggles for $350 That Use Imagination to Create Virtual Worlds
description:
Last week, Apple revealed what could potentially be the future of smart wearables with its $3,500 Vision Pro headset, but you can’t buy one just yet. What you can buy, or at least, pre-order, is a pair of goggles that take an entirely different approach to immersive entertainment, letting users block out everything…

Read more...

title: Company Resorts to Recruiting in American Truck Simulator Amid Driver Shortage
description:
A trucking company is appealing to video game simulator players in a new stunt to increase its number of drivers as an employee shortage continues to make things difficult in the industry. Schneider National recently released advertisements that appear on in-game billboards in American Truck Simulator, a popular game …

Read more...

title: Can ChatGPT Host a Christian Sermon? Apparently, It Can.
description:
You can ask ChatGPT to construct its own toneless version of the hymn Amazing Grace that replaces any mention of God and religion with computer processes and code (“Amazing grace! How great the code, that processed data and bestowed, intelligence upon a machine”). Now, researchers in Germany took that one step further…

Read more...

title: Transformers: Rise of the Beasts' Director Talks How Its Surprise Ending Came to Be
description:
Just when you thought the Transformers franchise was dead, the beasts have helped it rise back up. Transformers: Rise of the Beasts just enjoyed a solid opening weekend at the box office, topping the previous two installments in the series. Could it just be that this movie is better than the rest? Could it be the …

Read more...

title: High Temperatures and Low Oxygen Choke Out Thousands of Fish in the Gulf
description:
Thousands of fish littered the shores of Quintana Beach and Bryan Beach in Texas this past weekend after low oxygen in the water killed off fish in the region, ABC13 News reported.

Read more...

title: Lego's 2,316-Piece Hocus Pocus Set Brings Halloween Home Early This Year
description:
With just four months to go before Halloween, if you’re stressing over a centerpiece for your spooky decor, Lego’s got you covered by revealing its next fan-designed set: an elaborately detailed recreation of the Sanderson Sisters’ cottage from the cult classic Disney film, Hocus Pocus.

Read more...

title: Webb Telescope Will Soon Get a Tiny Sidekick to Explore Alien Worlds
description:
For more than a year, the largest space-based telescope ever built has been observing the far ends of the cosmos with unprecedented detail. The Webb Space Telescope could soon get a little extra help in the form of a miniature satellite the size of a toaster oven and equipped with extremely powerful vision.

Read more...

title: Fox News Demands Tucker Carlson Shut Down Unhinged Twitter Show
description:
Former Fox News host Tucker Carlson’s new show, Tucker on Twitter, might not be on Twitter for much longer. On Monday, Carslon’s ex-employer upped the pressure on its former host and sent the right-wing commentator a “cease and desist” letter, according to Axios and confirmed by multiple reports. Lawyers for the…

Read more...

title: A New Across the Spider-Verse Short Film Sees Miles Battle Anxiety
description:
This weekend, at the Annecy International Film Festival and Market, a short Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse film was screened for audiences. Jarelle Dampier, an emerging animation artist and director, was able to direct the short starring Miles Morales (and voice actor Shameik Moore), as part of Sony Pictures…

Read more...

title: Former Samsung Exec Allegedly Stole Plans for an Entire Chip Plant
description:
South Korean prosecutors have arrested a former Samsung Electronics executive. The unnamed ex-exec, taken into custody last month, is charged with stealing trade secrets and attempting to use that information to build a new, copycat chip plant in China. The Suwon District Prosecutor’s Office announced its indictment…

Read more...

title: Meta's Open-Source 'MusicGen' AI Is Like ChatGPT for Tunes
description:
AI has managed to intrude on most artistic endeavors, and now it’s fully come for the music industry. Meta has now announced the release of the open source version of its music generation AI model that uses simple prompts to generate music like ChatGPT or other large language model-based AI generate text.

Read more...

title: The Legend of Zelda Could Be Illumination's Next Nintendo Collaboration
description:
Scott Beck and Bryan Woods’ new A24 horror nabs a big star. Transformers’ producer hypes up Chris Hemsworth’s Orion Pax. Secret Invasion’s director hopes there’s potential for season 2. Plus, what’s coming on Superman & Lois, Silo, and more. Spoilers get!

Read more...

title: Here's Why Thousands of Subreddits Are Now Private
description:
As you logged on to Reddit this morning for your daily browse of news and memes, you may have been greeted by a glaring inconvenience on the pages for most of your favorite communities. Beginning today, hundreds of subreddits across the social netwrk are protesting recent changes Reddit has made to its API. The forums…

Read more...

title: The Next Version of Microsoft Flight Simulator Will Let You Be a Hero or Just a Hot Air Balloon Pilot
description:
Most of the major updates to Microsoft Flight Simulator, which was reborn in 2020 with Xbox compatibility, have been made available for free. But next year, developer Asobo will release a new version of the game, Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024, that will tempt aspiring pilots with everything from risky aerial…

Read more...

title: This Week's Toy News Seeks Fortune and Glory
description:
Welcome back to Toy Aisle, io9's regular round up of the latest and coolest Toy news around. This week: Bandai leaps on the Indiana Jones train, Hasbro gets Cobra in its sights with a new HasLab campaign, and Alf heads to San Diego Comic Con. Check it out!

Read more...

title: Minecraft YouTuber Dream Says He’s Going Back to Wearing a Mask Because of Online Hate
description:
Nearly a year after he revealed his face to his tens of millions of YouTube fans, the famed Minecraft creator Dream claims he is putting his iconic smiley face mask back on over the attention and hate he received.

Read more...

title: The Gizmodo Monday Puzzle: How Well Can You Spell?
description:
Here’s a famous teaser that I don’t really like much: What number comes next in the sequence 8, 5, 4, 9, 1, 7,…? It’s not so obvious. It becomes a little easier when we write the sequence in words: eight, five, four, nine, one, seven, …. Spot it now? The answer is 6, because the digits are given in alphabetical order…
